statement.tex: %text Sketch the graph of $y=\vert x + 3\vert$ and evaluate the area under the curve $y=\vert x+3\vert$, above the $x-$axis and between $x=-6$ to $x=0$. %

options.tex:
The required area $R$ is therefore
\[ R = -\inta \left(x+3 \right)\cdot dx + \intb \left(x+3 \right)\cdot dx \]

reason.tex:
From $x=-6\rightarrow -3$, we need the area under $y = - \left(x+3 \right)$\newline
And from $x=-3\rightarrow 0$, we need the area under $y = \left(x+3 \right)$\newline
And hence \[ R = -\inta \left(x+3 \right)\cdot dx + \intb \left(x+3 \right)\cdot dx \]
